title: Dabeli
instructions: Mix mashed potatoes with dabeli masala and tamarind chutney.
Slice pav buns and apply garlic chutney inside.
Stuff with the potato mixture, peanuts, pomegranate, and sev.
Toast the buns with butter on a tawa and serve hot.

title: Sandwich Dhokla
instructions: Prepare dhokla batter and steam a base layer.
Spread green and tamarind chutneys, then pour another batter layer on top.
Steam again until cooked, cut into pieces, and serve with chutney.

title: Ragda Pattice
instructions: Soak and cook white peas with spices to make ragda.
Prepare and shallow fry potato pattice.
Place pattice on a plate, pour ragda over, add chutneys, onions, sev, and garnish with coriander.

title: Vegetable Frankie
instructions: Prepare vegetable stuffing with spices and sautéed vegetables.
Place filling on roti, top with onions and chutney, sprinkle cheese if desired.
Roll and toast on tawa with a little butter. Serve hot.

title: Vegetable Puff
instructions: Prepare spiced vegetable stuffing.
Cut pastry sheets into squares, fill with the mixture, fold, and seal edges.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 20–25 minutes until golden and flaky.

title: Tomato Sev Sandwich
instructions: Spread butter and green chutney on bread slices.
Layer with tomato slices, sprinkle spices and sev.
Close with another slice and toast or serve fresh.

title: Onion Bhakri
instructions: Knead flour with onions, chilies, coriander, and spices into a dough.
Roll into thick discs and cook on a tawa with oil until crisp.
Serve with curd or pickle.

title: Multigrain Thepla
instructions: Knead dough with multigrain flour, methi leaves, curd, and spices.
Roll into thin theplas and cook on a tawa with oil.
Serve with pickle or yogurt.

title: Rajgira Paratha
instructions: Mix rajgira flour with mashed potatoes, chilies, and salt to form dough.
Roll into parathas using a plastic sheet and cook on tawa with ghee.
Serve hot during fasting or regular tiffin.

title: Khichu
instructions: Boil water with cumin, green chilies, and papad khar.
Add rice flour while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Steam the mixture for 5–7 minutes, drizzle with oil, and serve hot.

title: Bhakri with Sabzi
instructions: Mix flour, salt, and warm water to knead a soft dough.
Make flat rounds by patting with hands and cook on a hot tawa until both sides are golden.
For sabzi, heat oil, add cumin, onions, ginger-garlic paste and sauté.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and vegetables.
Cook until vegetables are soft. Serve hot with bhakri.

title: Palak Poori
instructions: Mix flour, spinach puree, ajwain, and salt to form a firm dough.
Divide into small balls and roll into pooris.
Heat oil and deep-fry the pooris until puffed and golden.
Serve hot with aloo sabzi or curd.

title: Vegetable Handvo
ingredients: 1 cup mixed lentils and rice (handvo flour)
instructions: Soak handvo flour in yogurt and a little water. Let it ferment overnight.
Add grated vegetables, spices, and fruit salt.
Pour batter into a greased pan, add mustard and sesame seeds on top.
Bake or cook on stovetop until golden and cooked through.
Serve warm with chutney.

title: Zunka Bhakri
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard, cumin, green chilies, and onions. Sauté well.
Add turmeric and gram flour. Stir continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook until mixture is thick. Serve hot with bhakri.
For bhakri, knead dough with warm water, flatten, and roast on tawa.

title: Tawa Pulao
instructions: Heat butter on a tawa, add onions and sauté.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook till soft.
Add spices and vegetables. Cook till tender.
Mix in rice and toss well. Garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.

title: Aloo Usal
instructions: Heat oil, splutter mustard and cumin seeds.
Add onions, ginger-garlic paste and sauté.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, chili, and salt.
Add potatoes and cook till well mixed and coated.
Garnish and serve with pav or rice.

title: Maharashtrian Poha Cutlet
instructions: Soak poha until soft, then drain water.
Mix with mashed potato, spices, and herbs.
Shape into cutlets and shallow fry till crisp.
Serve with ketchup or chutney.

title: Green Peas Thepla
instructions: Mix all ingredients into a soft dough.
Roll into thin theplas and cook on tawa with oil.
Serve with curd or pickle.

title: Cheese Corn Toast
instructions: Mix corn, cheese, and spices.
Spread butter on bread slices and top with mixture.
Toast in oven or pan until cheese melts.
Serve hot with ketchup.

title: Sheera (Sooji Halwa)
instructions: Heat ghee, roast sooji until golden and aromatic.
Boil water with sugar and cardamom powder.
Add water to sooji slowly, stirring continuously.
Cook until mixture thickens. Garnish with nuts and serve.

title: Moong Dal Dhokla
instructions: Soak moong dal, grind with chilies and ginger to a smooth batter.
Add fruit salt and steam the batter in a greased tray.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves, pour over dhokla, and cut into pieces.

title: Kanda Batata Bhaji
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden.
Add diced potatoes, turmeric, salt, and cook until tender. Serve hot.

title: Pithla Bhakri
instructions: Make pithla by cooking besan in tempered water with onions, garlic, and spices.
Knead jowar flour and roll into thick bhakris, roast on tawa.
Serve pithla hot with bhakri and chutney.

title: Vegetable Samosa
instructions: Prepare dough from maida. Make a spicy filling with boiled potatoes and veggies.
Stuff the dough cones with filling and seal the edges.
Deep fry until golden and serve with chutney.

title: Farali Dhokla
instructions: Mix flour with curd, chili paste, and fruit salt to form batter.
Steam the batter until fluffy.
Temper with oil and spices. Cut and serve with peanut chutney.

title: Tomato Rice
instructions: Sauté mustard seeds, onions, and garlic. Add chopped tomatoes and cook till soft.
Add spices and mix in cooked rice. Stir well.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Kokum Rice
instructions: Soak kokum in water and extract juice.
Temper mustard seeds, chilies, curry leaves, and hing.
Add kokum juice and mix with cooked rice. Stir and serve.

title: Vaal Usal
instructions: Soak and sprout vaal beans.
Sauté onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Add goda masala and sprouted vaal.
Cook till soft and serve with bhakri or rice.

title: Masala Thepla
instructions: Knead flour with spices, curd, and oil.
Roll into thin theplas and roast on tawa with oil.
Serve with curd or pickle.

title: Oats Thepla
instructions: Mix oats flour with wheat flour, methi, curd, and spices to make dough.
Roll into thin theplas and roast with oil.
Serve with chutney or curd.

title: Onion Potato Sandwich
instructions: In a bowl, mix mashed potato, onion, green chili, coriander, and salt.
Spread the mixture on a slice of bread and cover with another slice.
Butter the outside of the sandwich.
Grill or toast until golden and crisp.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

title: Dudhi Muthia
instructions: Mix all ingredients into a soft dough.
Shape into cylindrical rolls.
Steam the rolls for 15–20 minutes.
Cool, slice, and lightly sauté the pieces in oil with mustard seeds and sesame seeds.
Serve with green chutney.

title: Samosa Pav
instructions: Warm the pav and cut it in half.
Place a samosa in between each pav.
Add green and tamarind chutneys.
Sprinkle chaat masala and onions if desired.
Serve immediately.

title: Masala Chana Toast
instructions: Mash the chana and mix with onion, tomato, green chili, and spices.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Toast on a tawa with butter until crispy.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Khichdi with Kadhi
ingredients: Spices for tempering (mustard, curry leaves, chili)
instructions: Cook rice and dal with turmeric and salt to a soft consistency.
Whisk yogurt and besan with water, cook until thickened.
Temper the kadhi with spices in ghee.
Serve khichdi with hot kadhi.

title: Kadhi with Rice Cake
instructions: Mix yogurt, gram flour, turmeric, and water.
Boil and simmer till thickened.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Serve hot kadhi over sliced rice cakes.

title: Bajra Roti
instructions: Knead bajra flour with warm water and salt.
Roll into small rotis by hand.
Cook on tawa until both sides are done.
Serve hot with ghee and sabzi.

title: Churma Ladoo with Bajra Roti
instructions: Crumble bajra rotis finely.
Mix with melted jaggery and ghee.
Add dry fruits if using.
Form into ladoos and serve.

title: Gujarati Kadhi with Khichdi
instructions: Cook rice and dal together into a soft khichdi.
Prepare kadhi by boiling yogurt and besan mix.
Add tadka to kadhi.
Serve hot kadhi with khichdi.

title: Dhokli Nu Shaak
ingredients: Curry leaves, mustard, sesame for tempering
instructions: Make a paste of gram flour and curd.
Boil until thick, pour into greased tray and set.
Cut into squares and stir-fry with spices.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Egg Bhurji with Pav
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions, green chilies, and tomatoes.
Add spices and beaten eggs. Scramble until cooked.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with toasted pav.

title: Egg Masala Pav
instructions: Prepare a spicy masala with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Add beaten eggs and cook till soft.
Toast pav in butter, top with egg masala and serve.

title: Anda Curry with Thepla
instructions: Make a rich curry base with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Add coconut milk and boiled eggs. Simmer for flavor.
Serve hot with masala theplas.

title: Boiled Egg Misal
instructions: Prepare misal base with beans and spicy masala.
Add halved boiled eggs on top.
Garnish with farsan and coriander. Serve with pav.

title: Egg Frankie
instructions: Make spiced scrambled eggs with vegetables.
Spread green chutney on roti, add egg mix and roll it up.
Optional: Sprinkle cheese before rolling.

title: Omelette Pav
instructions: Beat eggs with chopped onions, chilies, and coriander.
Cook omelette on pan with butter.
Serve with buttered pav and green chutney.

title: Egg Dhokla
instructions: Prepare batter with besan, curd, eggs, and spices.
Add fruit salt and steam like dhokla.
Temper and garnish with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

title: Scrambled Egg Poha
instructions: Sauté onions and spices, then scramble eggs in the same pan.
Add soaked poha and mix well.
Cook until combined and garnish with coriander.

title: Anda Bhurji Toast
instructions: Prepare spicy egg bhurji with onions and chilies.
Toast bread slices and top with bhurji.
Serve warm as open-faced toasts.

title: Egg Rice (Spicy)
instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes, add spices and scrambled eggs.
Add cooked rice and mix thoroughly.
Serve hot with raita or plain curd.

title: Egg Curry with Bhakri
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook till fragrant.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Cook until oil separates.
Add water to adjust consistency and bring to a boil.
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with bhakri.

title: Anda Tawa Pulao
instructions: Heat oil on a tawa, scramble the eggs and set aside.
In the same tawa, sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add spices and mix well.
Add rice and scrambled eggs. Mix everything evenly.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Egg Stuffed Thepla
instructions: Make a thepla dough with wheat flour, methi, spices, and water.
Roll into thin circles.
Lightly cook one side of the thepla, flip and pour beaten egg on top.
Fold or cover and cook until egg sets.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Egg Puff
instructions: Sauté onions with curry powder and salt.
Cut puff pastry into squares.
Place some onion filling and half an egg in each.
Fold, seal edges, and apply egg wash.
Bake at 200°C for 20-25 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Egg Vada Pav
instructions: Slice eggs and spice with onion, chili, and spices.
Coat with besan batter and deep fry.
Serve in pav with chutneys.
Press and serve hot.

title: Egg Muthiya
instructions: Mix all ingredients into a firm dough.
Shape into logs and steam for 15 minutes.
Slice and temper with mustard seeds and sesame.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Anda Usal
instructions: Cook onion and tomato until soft.
Add goda masala and sprouts with water.
Simmer till sprouts are cooked.
Add sliced eggs, simmer briefly.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

title: Egg Sev Sandwich
instructions: Mix egg with onion, salt, and pepper.
Spread butter and chutney on bread.
Add egg filling and top with sev.
Cover with another slice and serve.

title: Egg Upma
instructions: Roast rava and set aside.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, sauté onion and chili.
Add beaten eggs and scramble.
Add water and bring to boil, then add rava.
Cook until fluffy, serve hot.

title: Egg Sabudana Khichdi
instructions: Heat oil, fry peanuts and set aside.
Sauté cumin, chili, and potato till soft.
Add sabudana and salt, cook on low heat.
Scramble eggs and mix into khichdi.
Top with lemon juice and peanuts. Serve.

title: Chicken Frankie
instructions: Cook chicken with spices and sauté onions and tomatoes.
Spread green chutney on roti, add chicken filling, and roll it up.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

title: Keema Pav
instructions: Cook minced chicken with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Simmer until the mixture thickens.
Serve hot with buttered pav.

title: Chicken Masala Pav
instructions: Cook chicken with onions, tomatoes, and spices to make a thick masala.
Serve with buttered pav.

title: Egg Chicken Frankie
instructions: Cook chicken with spices and sauté onions.
Scramble eggs and combine with chicken.
Spread green chutney on roti, add chicken-egg mix, and roll it up.

title: Chicken Samosa
instructions: Cook chicken with spices and onions.
Stuff samosa wrappers with chicken filling and deep fry until golden.

title: Chicken Puff
instructions: Cook chicken with spices and onions.
Stuff puff pastry with chicken mixture and bake until golden.

title: Chicken Curry with Thepla
instructions: Prepare a rich chicken curry with spices and simmer.
Serve with warm theplas.

title: Prawns Poha
instructions: Cook prawns with spices and sauté with poha.
Add curry leaves and serve.

title: Fish Masala with Bhakri
instructions: Cook fish with spices and onions.
Serve with fresh bhakri.

title: Chicken Cutlet
instructions: Prepare chicken filling with spices and onions.
Form patties, dip in breadcrumbs, and fry until golden.

title: Keema Thepla
instructions: In a bowl, mix the flour with cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add the cooked keema to the flour mixture and knead it into a dough using water.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin circles.
Heat oil in a pan and cook the rolled-out dough on both sides until golden brown.
Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

title: Chicken Dhokla Roll
instructions: Mix rice flour, chickpea flour, turmeric powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Add yogurt and water to the flour mixture to make a smooth batter.
Grease a steaming tray and pour the batter into it.
Steam the batter for 10-15 minutes until it is cooked.
Let it cool slightly, then roll it up with shredded chicken inside.
Cut into pieces and serve with chutney.

title: Tandoori Chicken Frankie
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, salt, and lemon juice for 2 hours.
Grill or cook the marinated chicken in a pan with oil until fully cooked.
Warm the flour tortillas and place grilled chicken in the center.
Roll the tortilla into a wrap and serve hot.

title: Fish Fry with Dhokla
instructions: Marinate the fish fillets with turmeric powder, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and lemon juice for 30 minutes.
Mix rice flour, chickpea flour, and baking soda to make a batter.
Dip the marinated fish fillets in the batter and fry them until crispy and golden.
Serve the fried fish with dhokla (steamed savory cake) on the side.

title: Chicken Vada Pav
instructions: Mix the minced chicken with turmeric, red chili powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt.
Form the chicken mixture into small patties and coat them with breadcrumbs.
Fry the patties in hot oil until golden brown.
Slice the pav and stuff them with the chicken patties, along with mint chutney and tamarind chutney.

title: Chicken Pulao
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté cumin seeds and sliced onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until tomatoes soften.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned.
Add rice, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Pour water and cook the rice and chicken together until the rice is tender and the chicken is fully cooked.

title: Fish Curry with Rice
instructions: In a pan, sauté cumin seeds and onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt, then add the fish fillets.
Pour in the coconut milk and simmer until the fish is cooked.
Cook basmati rice separately, and serve the fish curry with rice.

title: Mutton Pav
instructions: Cook the mutton with ginger-garlic paste, onions, tomatoes, and spices until tender.
Fry pav in oil until crispy.
Serve the cooked mutton with the pav and garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Fish Frankie
instructions: Marinate the fish fillets with turmeric, red chili powder, cumin powder, salt, and lemon juice.
Grill or cook the marinated fish in a pan until fully cooked.
Place the grilled fish on tortillas and add sliced onions and mint chutney.
Roll the tortillas into wraps and serve.

title: Prawns Thepla
instructions: Mix the flour with turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and cooked prawns.
Knead the mixture into a dough using water.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin circles.
Cook the rolled-out dough on a hot pan with oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

title: Tandoori Paneer Sandwich
instructions: Marinate the paneer cubes with yogurt, tandoori masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, and salt.
Grill the marinated paneer cubes until they are golden and cooked.
Toast the bread slices with butter on both sides.
Place the grilled paneer between two slices of bread, garnish with chopped coriander leaves, and serve.

title: Stuffed Spinach Roll
instructions: Sauté cumin seeds and onions until golden, then add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt, and mix well.
Add grated paneer and cook for another 5 minutes.
Spoon the spinach mixture onto tortillas and roll them tightly.
Serve with yogurt or chutney.

title: Multigrain Idli
instructions: Mix all the flours in a bowl with salt and baking soda.
Add water gradually to make a smooth batter.
Grease the idli molds and pour the batter into them.
Steam for 10-15 minutes until cooked.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Millet Upma
instructions: Dry roast the millet until lightly browned.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, and sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add peas, turmeric, salt, and water, then bring it to a boil.
Add the millet and cook until the millet is soft and water is absorbed.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Ragi Thepla
instructions: Mix ragi flour, wheat flour, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
Gradually add water to make a smooth dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin circles.
Cook the rolled-out dough on a hot griddle with oil until golden brown.
Serve with chutney or yogurt.

title: Cheese Veg Frankie
instructions: Sauté the mixed vegetables and paneer with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add grated cheese to the vegetable mixture and cook until it melts.
Warm the tortillas, stuff them with the cheese-vegetable mixture, and roll them up.
Grill the rolls in butter until crispy and golden brown.

title: Paneer Maggi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions and tomatoes until soft.
Add paneer cubes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add water according to the Maggi packet instructions and bring to a boil.
Add the Maggi noodles and cook until the noodles are done.
Serve hot.

title: Makhana Poha
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and onions, and sauté until golden.
Add peas and turmeric powder, then add makhana.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Vegetable Quesadilla (Indian-style)
instructions: Sauté the mixed vegetables with cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add grated cheese to the cooked vegetables and mix.
Place the vegetable mixture on a tortilla, cover with another tortilla, and grill with butter until golden and crispy.
Cut into wedges and serve hot.

title: Chickpea Roll
instructions: Mash the boiled chickpeas and sauté them with onions, tomatoes, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Warm the tortillas, stuff them with the chickpea mixture, and roll them up.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

title: Hummus Paratha Wrap
instructions: Warm the parathas on a tawa or skillet.
Spread hummus evenly on each paratha.
Layer with grated carrots, cucumbers, lettuce, and onions.
Sprinkle salt and black pepper over the veggies.
Roll the parathas tightly into wraps.
Serve immediately or wrap in foil for lunchbox.

title: Paneer Tikka Sandwich
instructions: Marinate paneer with yogurt, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté marinated paneer until golden.
Butter the bread slices and place paneer filling between two slices.
Toast the sandwich on a pan or sandwich maker until golden.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Veggie Moong Dal Toast
instructions: Grind soaked moong dal into a thick batter.
Add vegetables, chili, coriander, and salt to the batter.
Spread the mixture on one side of the bread slice.
Heat a pan with little oil and toast the batter side first.
Flip and toast the other side until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

title: Tofu Bhurji with Roti
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Sauté onions and green chili until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft.
Add turmeric, garam masala, and salt.
Add crumbled tofu and sauté for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot with roti.

title: Beetroot Dosa
instructions: Mix grated beetroot, chili, and salt into the dosa batter.
Heat a tawa and pour a ladle of batter to spread into a dosa.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until crisp.
Flip if needed and cook the other side.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Carrot Idli
instructions: Mix grated carrot and coriander into the idli batter.
Grease idli molds and pour the batter.
Steam for 10-12 minutes until cooked through.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Soya Stuffed Paratha
instructions: Soak soya granules in hot water for 10 mins, then squeeze excess water.
Sauté onions and cumin seeds, then add soya and spices. Cook until dry.
Knead dough with wheat flour and water.
Roll out dough, fill with soya mix, and seal.
Roll again and roast on tawa with ghee/oil.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

title: Moong Sprout Cutlet
instructions: Mash the sprouts and potato together.
Add chili, masala, breadcrumbs, and salt.
Shape into cutlets and shallow fry until golden on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Avocado Paratha
instructions: Mix mashed avocado with flour, chili, cumin, and salt.
Add water if needed to make a soft dough.
Roll into parathas and cook on tawa with oil until golden.
Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

title: Curd Sandwich
instructions: Mix curd, vegetables, pepper, and salt in a bowl.
Spread the mixture between two slices of bread.
Toast with butter on a pan until golden.
Serve immediately with sauce or chutney.
